title: EU emissions fall to lowest level in three decades as countries ditch coal
lead: The drop was mainly driven by the power sector, where emissions fell by almost 15%, primarily due to coal-fired power production being replaced by electricity from renewables and gas

title: European Energy granted €40m for large-scale solar and wind projects
lead: The loan from the Danish Green Investment Fund will support European Energy’s ambition to construct 750MW of new green power capacity from solar and wind by 2021 and an additional 1GW in 2022

title: The low carbon league table: Which countries are on track for COP26?
lead: Independent analysis conducted by academics from Imperial College London for Drax Electric Insights deep-dives into the changes driving Great Britain’s electricity system over the last 3 months.

title: Repsol to inject €5.5bn in low carbon generation by 2025
lead: The Spanish oil and gas giant is targetting a global portfolio of 7.5GW of renewable energy generation capacity by 2025

title: Ofgem gives £9m to hydrogen research facility
lead: Cash part of £12.7 million project investigating how transmission assets could transport hydrogen in the future

title: Tasmania reaches 100% renewable electricity goal two years ahead of schedule
lead: Legislation aims to double the island’s current renewable energy generation by 2040

title: Ofgem approves EDF’s last resort supply payment claim of £4.2m
lead: The energy supplier is seeking to claim certain additional costs incurred after taking on former supplier Solarplicity’s customers last year

title: InterGen gets green light for ‘UK’s largest’ battery project in Essex
lead: The £200m project is expected to provide at least 320MW of capacity, with the potential to expand to 1.3GWh

title: Dubai launches 800MW third phase of the ‘largest single-site solar park in the world’
lead: The third phase is forecast to provide renewable energy for more than 240,000 homes

title: EU approves German scheme to compensate hard coal plants for early closure
lead: The energy regulator will publish seven tenders for the closure of hard coal and small lignite-fired power plants that will take place annually until 2026
